prior: Pantographs are typically composed of slender metal rods with a geometric link structure; coverage is often low (<10%), with fragmented and easily broken boundaries; common interference is slender backgrounds such as wires/supports.
failure_modes: false detection of thin background lines
suggestions: connectivity<0.6, use strong erosion/opening operations with caution
priority to preserve fine structure (light post-processing)

prior: Bolt Mostly small targets with clear boundaries but small scale; easily interfered with by metallic reflections and background textures.
suggestions: Increase resolution or segmentation when coverage is very low
Preserve small connected components in postprocessing postprocess_preserve_small

prior: Person is usually a medium to large target with variable shape (limbs); relatively continuous boundaries, commonly occluded.
suggestions: Try filling holes/connectivity repair when connectivity is poor
Try segmentation or finer-grained hints when adhesion occurs
